title: Colonial America and Early Settlement

vocab.definition: A settlement controlled by a distant country
A document giving permission to establish a colony
A colony owned and governed by an individual
A person who worked for a period to pay for passage to America
An economic system where colonies provide raw materials to the mother country

teachingNotes: Compare different types of colonies and their purposes. Discuss how geography influenced colonial development.

sample.question: What is a settlement controlled by a distant country?

truefalse.question: Indentured servants worked for a period to pay for their passage to America.

multiplechoice.question: What economic system required colonies to provide raw materials?

fillintheblank.question: A document giving permission to establish a colony is called a ________.

shortanswer.question: Why did different colonies develop different economies?
